ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The class teaches you both how to critically evaluate as well as present the literature to one another. I'd definitely recommend it, since it teaches you things that are very important for grad students to know.

This class is a seminar course where you learn how to read scientific literature from various areas and practice presenting papers. I would recommend it since Diane really helped everyone gain an understanding of the literature and improved our presentation skills.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The class taught me about areas of research I didn't know much about previously, and also gave me a lot of practice with putting together presentations and reading papers, which are both necessary things to know.
This course gave me morepractice on reading and critically analyzing primary literature.

Reading primary literature and being able to present are two skills that will be used throughout my research and this class helped with both. I learned some about stem cell differentiation, hematopoesis, cancer, and reactive oxygen species, but overall the skill set gained from this course was more useful to me since I most likely will not be working in most of these areas.
